thread.title: Bangladesh politician treats 30,000 to 7,500 kg of meat and fish feast
thread.title_full: Bangladesh politician treats 30,000 to 7,500 kg of meat and fish feast

title: Bangladesh politician treats 30,000 to 7,500 kg of meat and fish feast
text:
Bangladesh politician treats 30,000 to 7,500 kg of meat and fish feast Joypurhat   Previous Next As many as 90 chefs have sweated out to please their host who had ordered them to cook 4,500 kg of meats, 3,000 kg of fish and 5,500 kg of vegetable for his guests in a village feast. 
They used 600 burners and took help from 120 assistants to prepare the meal for 30,000 in a Joypurhat village. 
Around 1700 kg of curd and 1500 kg of sweets were used in the party, the biggest in the history of Boar village of Akkelpur Upazila of the district, on Tuesday. “I don’t have any political ambition. This is part of our family tradition,” said Ziaul Huq Zia, the Upazila Krishak League joint convenor who hosted the feast.
Local police made security arrangements for the party while some 1,500 volunteers worked for seven days in the lead-up to the event. 
Mostly disposable plates were used in two separate sitting arrangements – chair-table for the distinguished guests and mat on the floor for the less privileged ones. Besides the sumptuous meal, village sports and folk song competition were also arranged on the occasion.
Joypurhat Deputy Commissioner Abdur Rahim told bdnews24.com that he heard about the programme but did not have any details. 
“The local tax department should be informed before arranging this kind of programme,” he added.
